text: فلعلك بخع نفسك على ءاثرهم ان لم يؤمنوا۟ بهذا الحديث اسفا

translations.translation: Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not have iman in these words.
Will you kill yourself for grief of them if they do not believe in this presentation?
(O Muhammad), if they do not believe in this Message, you will perhaps torment yourself to death with grief, sorrowing over them.
Perhaps you will destroy yourself out of grief because they disbelieve this Book.
Possibly you may risk your life by grieving (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) for them if they do not believe in this narration.
Perhaps, you would kill yourself in grief, over their footsteps, because they believe not in this narration.
Then maybe you will kill yourself with grief, sorrowing after them, if they do not believe in this announcement.
Yet perchance, if they believe not in this tiding, thou wilt consume thyself, following after them, of grief.
Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement, that thou (Muhammad) wilt torment thy soul with grief over their footsteps.
Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief if they do not believe in this message.
Haply thou art going to kill thyself over their footsteps, if they believe not in this discourse, out of sorrow.
You are liable to imperil your life out of grief for their sake, if they should not believe this discourse.
Thou wouldst only, perchance, fret thyself to death, following after them, in grief, if they believe not in this Message.
Perhaps, you, would kill yourself (O Muhammad SAW) in grief, over their footsteps (for their turning away from you), because they believe not in this narration (the Quran).
Yet perchance, if they do not believe in this tiding, you will consume yourself with grief and follow after them.
Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not believe in this information.
Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

[18:6] Yet it may be that you will consume, destroy, yourself in their wake — following [your being with] them, that is, after they have left you — if they should not believe in this discourse, [in this] Qur’ān, out of grief, out of rage and anguish on your part, because of your eagerness that they believe (asafan, ‘out of grief’, is in the accusative because it functions as an object denoting reason).
(Yet it may be, if they believe not in this statement) if they do not believe in this Qur'an, (that thou) Muhammad (wilt torment thy soul) kill yourself (with grief over their footsteps) for them.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فَلَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ } معناه قَاتلُ نَفْسِكَ ومهُلِكِهَا




وقوله تعالى: { بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَسَفاً } معناهُ نَدِمٌ

translations.translation:
And his saying, {So perhaps you would kill yourself with grief over them} [means that] you kill yourself and destroy it.


And His saying, "With this [hadith] I am grieved," its meaning is remorse.

commentaries.author: ابن عربي
commentaries.text: { فلعلك باخع } أي: مهلك { نفسك } من شدّة الوجد والأسف على توليهم وإعراضهم، وذلك لأن الشفقة على خلق الله والرحمة عليهم من لوازم محبة الله ونتائجه ولما كان صلى الله عليه وسلم حبيب الله ومن لوازم محبوبيته محبته لله لقوله:

translations.translation:
You may be { destroying yourself } out of the intensity of your awareness and regret at having to deal with them and their opposition.,

And that is because the mercy of Allah and His compassion for His creatures are among the signs of His love for Allah, and the results of that love. And because the Prophet Muhammad is the beloved of Allah and among the signs of His love for the Prophet is His love for Allah, as He said:

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبعدما كان حالهم في الافتراء والمراء على هذا المنوال، وشدة غيظهم وشكيمتهم مع الله على هذا المثال: { فَلَعَلَّكَ } يا أكمل الرسل بمحبتك ومودتك إيمانهم وانقيادهم، وبرجائك وتحننك إلى بيعتهم ومتابعتهم { بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ } أي: قاتلها ومهلكها { عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ } عندما انصرفوا عنك وذهبوا { إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُواْ } أي: إن هم لم يؤمنوا ولم يصدِّقوا { بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ } اي: القرآن { أَسَفاً } [الكهف: 6] يعني: أهلكت نفسك بكثرة التأسف والتحزن على ذهابهم وانصرافهم عنك، وعدم إيمانهم وانقيادهم بك، وإنْ بعثك وحَداك إلى إيمانهم واتباعهم غناهم ورئاستُهم وترفههم وجاههم وثروتهم وسيادتُهم بين الناس، فاعلم أنه لا اعتداد لها ولا اعتبار بما يترتب عليها

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
قلت: { أسفًا }: مفعول من أجله لباخع، أو حال، أي: متأسفًا، وجواب " إن ": محذوف، أي: إن لم يؤمنوا فعلك باخع نفسك
 يقول الحقّ جلّ جلاله: { فلعلك } يا محمد { باخعٌ }: مهلك { نفسَك } وقاتلها بالغم والأسف على تخلف قومك عن الإيمان وفراقهم عنك، { على آثارهم } إذا تولوا عنك، عندما تدعوهم إلى الله
 شبهه، لأجل ما تداخله من الوجد على توليتهم، بمن فارقته أعزته، وهو يتحسر على آثارهم، ويبخع نفسه وجدًا عليهم
 { إِن لم يُؤمنوا بهذا الحديث } أي: القرآن الذي عبّر عنه في صدر السورة بالكتاب، صدر ذلك منك { أسفًا } أي: بفرط الحزن والتأسف عليهم
